the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n  limitations under the License.\n\n*/\n\npragma solidity >=0.5.9 <0.9.0;\n\nimport \"./interfaces/IAuthorizable.sol\";\nimport \"./Ownable.sol\";\n\n// solhint-disable no-empty-blocks\n// TODO: check if should use OwnedUninitialized and remove duplicate contract\nabstract contract Authorizable is Ownable, IAuthorizable {\n    /// @dev Only authorized addresses can invoke functions with this modifier.\n    modifier onlyAuthorized() {\n        _assertSenderIsAuthorized();\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Whether an address is authorized to call privileged functions.\n    /// @dev 0 Address to query.\n    /// @return 0 Whether the address is authorized.\n    mapping(address => bool) public authorized;\n    /// @dev Whether an adderss is authorized to call privileged functions.\n    /// @dev 0 Index of authorized address.\n    /// @return 0 Authorized address.\n    address[] public authorities;\n\n    /// @dev Initializes the `owner` address.\n    constructor(address newOwner) Ownable(newOwner) {}\n\n    /// @dev Authorizes an address.\n    /// @param target Address to authorize.\n    function addAuthorizedAddress(address target) external override onlyOwner {\n        _addAuthorizedAddress(target);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Removes authorizion of an address.\n    /// @param target Address to remove authorization from.\n    function removeAuthorizedAddress(address target) external override onlyOwner {\n        require(authorized[target], \"TARGET_NOT_AUTHORIZED\");\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < authorities.length; i++) {\n            if (authorities[i] == target) {\n                _removeAuthorizedAddressAtIndex(target, i);\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Removes authorizion of an address.\n    /// @param target Address to remove authorization from.\n    /// @param index Index of target in authorities array.\n    function removeAuthorizedAddressAtIndex(address target, uint256 index) external override onlyOwner {\n        _removeAuthorizedAddressAtIndex(target, index);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Gets all authorized addresses.\n    /// @return Array of authorized addresses.\n    function getAuthorizedAddresses() external view override returns (address[] memory) {\n        return authorities;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Reverts if msg.sender is not authorized.\n    function _assertSenderIsAuthorized() internal view {\n        require(authorized[msg.sender], \"AUTHORIZABLE_SENDER_NOT_AUTHORIZED_ERROR\");\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Authorizes an address.\n    /// @param target Address to authorize.\n    function _addAuthorizedAddress(address target) internal {\n        // Ensure that the target is not the zero address.\n        require(target != address(0), \"AUTHORIZABLE_NULL_ADDRESS_ERROR\");\n\n        // Ensure that the target is not already authorized.\n        require(!authorized[target], \"AUTHORIZABLE_ALREADY_AUTHORIZED_ERROR\");\n\n        authorized[target] = true;\n        authorities.push(target);\n        emit AuthorizedAddressAdded(target, msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Removes authorization of an address.\n    /// @param target Address to remove authorization from.\n    /// @param index Index of target in authorities array.\n    function _removeAuthorizedAddressAtIndex(address target, uint256 index) internal {\n        require(authorized[target], \"AUTHORIZABLE_ADDRESS_NOT_AUTHORIZED_ERROR\");\n        require(index < authorities.length, \"AUTHORIZABLE_INDEX_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_ERROR\");\n        require(authorities[index] == target, \"AUTHORIZABLE_ADDRESS_MISMATCH_ERROR\");\n\n        delete authorized[target];\n        authorities[index] = authorities[authorities.length - 1];\n        authorities.pop();\n        emit AuthorizedAddressRemoved(target, msg.sender);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xbb14576d94fe826b03b455dc0263cc2599a9b87ecda04d8d43dc54480376359f","license":"Apache 2.0"},"contracts/utils/0xUtils/LibFractions.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache 2.0\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nlibrary LibFractions {\n    /// @dev Safely adds two fractions `n1/d1 + n2/d2`\n    /// @param n1 numerator of `1`\n    /// @param d1 denominator of `1`\n    /// @param n2 numerator of `2`\n    /// @param d2 denominator of `2`\n    /// @return numerator Numerator of sum\n    /// @return denominator Denominator of sum\n    function add(\n        uint256 n1,\n        uint256 d1,\n        uint256 n2,\n        uint256 d2\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 numerator, uint256 denominator) {\n        if (n1 == 0) {\n            return (numerator = n2, denominator = d2);\n        }\n        if (n2 == 0) {\n            return (numerator = n1, denominator = d1);\n        }\n        numerator = n1 * d2 + (n2 * d1);\n        denominator = d1 * d2;\n        return (numerator, denominator);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Rescales a fraction to prevent overflows during addition if either\n    ///      the numerator or the denominator are > `maxValue`.\n    /// @param numerator The numerator.\n    /// @param denominator The denominator.\n    /// @param maxValue The maximum value allowed for both the numerator and\n    ///        denominator.\n    /// @return scaledNumerator The rescaled numerator.\n    /// @return scaledDenominator The rescaled denominator.\n    function normalize(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 maxValue\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 scaledNumerator, uint256 scaledDenominator) {\n        // If either the numerator or the denominator are > `maxValue`,\n        // re-scale them by `maxValue` to prevent overflows in future operations.\n        if (numerator > maxValue || denominator > maxValue) {\n            uint256 rescaleBase = numerator >= denominator ? numerator : denominator;\n            rescaleBase = rescaleBase / maxValue;\n            scaledNumerator = numerator / rescaleBase;\n            scaledDenominator = denominator / rescaleBase;\n        } else {\n            scaledNumerator = numerator;\n            scaledDenominator = denominator;\n        }\n        return (scaledNumerator, scaledDenominator);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Rescales a fraction to prevent overflows during addition if either\n    ///      the numerator or the denominator are > 2 ** 127.\n    /// @param numerator The numerator.\n    /// @param denominator The denominator.\n    /// @return scaledNumerator The rescaled numerator.\n    /// @return scaledDenominator The rescaled denominator.\n    function normalize(uint256 numerator, uint256 denominator)\n        internal\n        pure\n        returns (uint256 scaledNumerator, uint256 scaledDenominator)\n    {\n        return normalize(numerator, denominator, 2**127);\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Safely scales the difference between two fractions.\n    /// @param n1 numerator of `1`\n    /// @param d1 denominator of `1`\n    /// @param n2 numerator of `2`\n    /// @param d2 denominator of `2`\n    /// @param s scalar to multiply by difference.\n    /// @return result `s * (n1/d1 - n2/d2)`.\n    function scaleDifference(\n        uint256 n1,\n        uint256 d1,\n        uint256 n2,\n        uint256 d2,\n        uint256 s\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 result) {\n        if (s == 0) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        if (n2 == 0) {\n            return result = (s * n1) / d1;\n        }\n        uint256 numerator = n1 * d2 - (n2 * d1);\n        uint256 tmp = numerator / d2;\n        return (s * tmp) / d1;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x7706518485975fb4fb562922f80fa1b8c7eb5b8887cd861d5e3ff22a40ae0fde","license":"Apache 2.0"},"contracts/utils/0xUtils/LibMath.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache 2.0\n/*\n\n  Copyright 2019 ZeroEx Intl.\n\n  Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n  you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n  You may obtain a copy of the License at\n\n    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n\n  Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n  distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n  limitations under the License.\n\n*/\n\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nlibrary LibMath {\n    /// @dev Calculates partial value given a numerator and denominator rounded down.\n    ///      Reverts if rounding error is >= 0.1%\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to calculate partial of.\n    /// @return partialAmount Partial value of target rounded down.\n    function safeGetPartialAmountFloor(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 partialAmount) {\n        require(!isRoundingErrorFloor(numerator, denominator, target), \"LIBMATH_ROUNDING_FLOOR_ERROR\");\n\n        partialAmount = (numerator * target) / denominator;\n        return partialAmount;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Calculates partial value given a numerator and denominator rounded down.\n    ///      Reverts if rounding error is >= 0.1%\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to calculate partial of.\n    /// @return partialAmount Partial value of target rounded up.\n    function safeGetPartialAmountCeil(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 partialAmount) {\n        require(!isRoundingErrorCeil(numerator, denominator, target), \"LIBMATH_ROUNDING_CEIL_ERROR\");\n\n        // safeDiv computes `floor(a / b)`. We use the identity (a, b integer):\n        //       ceil(a / b) = floor((a + b - 1) / b)\n        // To implement `ceil(a / b)` using safeDiv.\n        partialAmount = (numerator * target + (denominator - 1)) / denominator;\n\n        return partialAmount;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Calculates partial value given a numerator and denominator rounded down.\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to calculate partial of.\n    /// @return partialAmount Partial value of target rounded down.\n    function getPartialAmountFloor(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 partialAmount) {\n        partialAmount = (numerator * target) / denominator;\n        return partialAmount;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Calculates partial value given a numerator and denominator rounded down.\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to calculate partial of.\n    /// @return partialAmount Partial value of target rounded up.\n    function getPartialAmountCeil(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 partialAmount) {\n        // safeDiv computes `floor(a / b)`. We use the identity (a, b integer):\n        //       ceil(a / b) = floor((a + b - 1) / b)\n        // To implement `ceil(a / b)` using safeDiv.\n        partialAmount = (numerator * target + (denominator - 1)) / denominator;\n\n        return partialAmount;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Checks if rounding error >= 0.1% when rounding down.\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to multiply with numerator/denominator.\n    /// @return isError Rounding error is present.\n    function isRoundingErrorFloor(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isError) {\n        require(denominator != 0, \"LIBMATH_DIVISION_BY_ZERO_ERROR\");\n\n        // The absolute rounding error is the difference between the rounded\n        // value and the ideal value. The relative rounding error is the\n        // absolute rounding error divided by the absolute value of the\n        // ideal value. This is undefined when the ideal value is zero.\n        //\n        // The ideal value is `numerator * target / denominator`.\n        // Let's call `numerator * target % denominator` the remainder.\n        // The absolute error is `remainder / denominator`.\n        //\n        // When the ideal value is zero, we require the absolute error to\n        // be zero. Fortunately, this is always the case. The ideal value is\n        // zero iff `numerator == 0` and/or `target == 0`. In this case the\n        // remainder and absolute error are also zero.\n        if (target == 0 || numerator == 0) {\n            return false;\n        }\n\n        // Otherwise, we want the relative rounding error to be strictly\n        // less than 0.1%.\n        // The relative error is `remainder / (numerator * target)`.\n        // We want the relative error less than 1 / 1000:\n        //        remainder / (numerator * denominator)  <  1 / 1000\n        // or equivalently:\n        //        1000 * remainder  <  numerator * target\n        // so we have a rounding error iff:\n        //        1000 * remainder  >=  numerator * target\n        uint256 remainder = mulmod(target, numerator, denominator);\n        isError = remainder * 1000 >= numerator * target;\n        return isError;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Checks if rounding error >= 0.1% when rounding up.\n    /// @param numerator Numerator.\n    /// @param denominator Denominator.\n    /// @param target Value to multiply with numerator/denominator.\n    /// @return isError Rounding error is present.\n    function isRoundingErrorCeil(\n        uint256 numerator,\n        uint256 denominator,\n        uint256 target\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isError) {\n        require(denominator != 0, \"LIBMATH_DIVISION_BY_ZERO_ERROR\");\n\n        // See the comments in `isRoundingError`.\n        if (target == 0 || numerator == 0) {\n            // When either is zero, the ideal value and rounded value are zero\n            // and there is no rounding error. (Although the relative error\n            // is undefined.)\n            return false;\n        }\n        // Compute remainder as before\n        uint256 remainder = mulmod(target, numerator, denominator);\n        remainder = (denominator - remainder) % denominator;\n        isError = remainder * 1000 >= numerator * target;\n        return isError;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x2cd1587c632c97ae1b86a61c933bca2a4496e82f2e8aa28317ae9b8c870ea9e0","license":"Apache 2.0"},"contracts/utils/0xUtils/Ownable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache License.\n*/\n\npragma solidity >=0.5.9 <0.9.0;\n\nimport \"./interfaces/IOwnable.sol\";\n\nabstract contract Ownable is IOwnable {\n    /// @dev The owner of this contract.\n    /// @return 0 The owner address.\n    address public owner;\n\n    constructor(address newOwner) {\n        owner = newOwner;\n    }\n\n    modifier onlyOwner() {\n        _assertSenderIsOwner();\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /// @dev Change the owner of this contract.\n    /// @param newOwner New owner address.\n    function transferOwnership(address newOwner) public override onlyOwner {\n        require(newOwner != address(0), \"INPUT_ADDRESS_NULL_ERROR\");\n        owner = newOwner;\n        emit OwnershipTransferred(msg.sender, newOwner);\n    }\n\n    function _assertSenderIsOwner() internal view {\n        require(msg.sender == owner, \"CALLER_NOT_OWNER_ERROR\");\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe720a6261e1cb8d0ff3c1bc834f787228021a4f8d70c2806248edd3c91bb12b2","license":"Apache See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n  limitations under the License.\n*/\n\npragma solidity >=0.5.9 <0.9.0;\n\nabstract contract IAuthorizable {\n    /// @dev Emitted when a new address is authorized.\n    /// @param target Address of the authorized address.\n    /// @param caller Address of the address that authorized the target.\n    event address.\n    /// @param caller Address of the address that authorized the target.\n    event AuthorizedAddressRemoved(address indexed target, address indexed caller);\n\n    /// @dev Authorizes an address.\n    /// @param target Address to authorize.\n    function addAuthorizedAddress(address target) external virtual;\n\n    /// @dev Removes authorizion of an address.\n    /// @param target Address to remove authorization from.\n    function removeAuthorizedAddress(address target) external virtual;\n\n    /// @dev Removes authorizion of an address.\n    /// @param target Address to Gets all authorized addresses.\n    /// @return Array of authorized addresses.\n    function getAuthorizedAddresses() external view virtual returns (address[] memory);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x84b5b063527971800efe5dd2d5264d0e3b96daae16412e225181d67efbdc4ccc","license":"Apache 2.0"},"contracts/utils/0xUtils/interfaces/IOwnable.sol":{"content":"// previous owner of the contract.\n    /// @param newOwner The new owner of the contract.\n    event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed previousOwner, address indexed newOwner);\n\n    /// @dev params.addr: Address of proof_of_performance contract to add.

constructor.details: Initializing immutable implementation address is used to allow delegatecalls only.Direct calls to the  implementation contract are effectively locked.

params.poolRegistry: Address of the RigoBlock pool registry.

createStakingPool(address).details: Note that a staking pal must be payable.When governance updates registry address, pools must be migrated to new registry, or this contract must query from both.

params.rigoblockPoolAddress: Adds rigoblock pool to the created staking pool for convenience if non-null.

returns.poolId: The unique pool id generated for this pool.

creditPopReward(address,uint256).details: Only a known RigoBlock pop can call this method. See (MixinPopManager).

params.poolAccount: The address of the rigoblock pool account.

params.newOperatorShare: The newly decreased percentage of any rewards owned by the operator.

endEpoch().details: Throws if not enough time has passed between epochs or if theprevious epoch was not fully finalized.

finalizePool(bytes32).details: crediting it rewards for members and withdrawing operator's rewards as GRG.This can be called by internal functions that need to finalize a pool immediately.Does nothing if the pool is already finalized or did not earn rewards in the previous epoch.

getCurrentEpochEarliestEndTimeInSeconds(.details: The next epoch can begin once this time is reached.Epoch period = [startTimeInSeconds..endTimeInSeconds)

getGrgContract().details: Must be view to allow overrides to access state.

getGrgVault().details: Must be view to allow overrides to access state.

returns.balance: Owner's stake balances for given status.

returns._cobbDouglasAlphaDenominator: Denominator for cobb douglas alpha factor.
returns._cobbDouglasAlphaNumerator: Numerator for cobb douglas alpha factor.
returns._minimumPoolStake: Minimum amount of stake required in a pool to collect rewards.
returns._rewardDelegatedStakeWeight: How much delegated stake is weighted vs operator stake, in ppm.

getPoolRegistry().details: Must be view to allow overrides to access state.

returns.balance: Stake delegated to pool by staker.

init().details: This function should not be called directly.The StakingProxy contract will call it in `attachStakingContract()`.

moveStake((uint8,bytes32),(uint8,bytes32.details: Delegated stake can also be moved between pools.This change comes into effect next epoch.

params.from: Status to move stake out of.

params.index: Index of target in authorities array.

params.addr: Address of proof_of_performance contract to remove.

params._cobbDouglasAlphaDenominator: Denominator for cobb douglas alpha factor.
params._cobbDouglasAlphaNumerator: Numerator for cobb douglas alpha factor.
params._minimumPoolStake: Minimum amount of stake required in a pool to collect rewards.
params._rewardDelegatedStakeWeight: How much delegated stake is weighted vs operator stake, in ppm.

params.newStakingPalAddress: Address of the new staking pal.

stake(uint256).details: Unstake to retrieve the GRG. Stake is in the 'Active' status.

transferOwnership(address).details: Change the owner of this contract.

unstake(uint256).details: Stake must be in the 'undelegated' status in both the current and next epoch in order to be unstaked.

CatchStringEvent(string).notice: Emitted whenever an inflation mint call is reverted.

EpochEnded(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: Emitted by MixinFinalizer when an epoch has ended.

EpochFinalized(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted by MixinFinalizer when an epoch is fully finalized.

GrgMintEvent(uint256).notice: Emitted when an inflation mint call is executed successfully.

MoveStake(address,uint256,uint8,bytes32,.notice: Emitted by MixinStake when GRG is unstaked.

OperatorShareDecreased(bytes32,uint32,ui.notice: Emitted when a staking pool's operator share is decreased.

ParamsSet(uint256,uint32,uint256,uint256.notice: Emitted whenever staking parameters are changed via the `setParams()` function.

PopAdded(address).notice: Emitted by MixinExchangeManager when an exchange is added.

PopRemoved(address).notice: Emitted by MixinExchangeManager when an exchange is removed.

RbPoolStakingPoolSet(address,bytes32).notice: Emitted by MixinStakingPool when a rigoblock pool is added to its staking pool.

ReturnDataEvent(bytes).notice: Emitted to catch any other inflation mint call fail.

RewardsPaid(uint256,bytes32,uint256,uint.notice: Emitted by MixinFinalizer when rewards are paid out to a pool.

Stake(address,uint256).notice: Emitted by MixinStake when GRG is staked.

StakingPoolCreated(bytes32,address,uint3.notice: Emitted by MixinStakingPool when a new pool is created.

StakingPoolEarnedRewardsInEpoch(uint256,.notice: Emitted by MixinExchangeFees when a pool starts earning rewards in an epoch.

Unstake(address,uint256).notice: Emitted by MixinStake when GRG is unstaked.

aggregatedStatsByEpoch(uint256).notice: Aggregated stats across all pools that generated fees with sufficient stake to earn rewards.

cobbDouglasAlphaDenominator().notice: Denominator for cobb douglas alpha factor.

cobbDouglasAlphaNumerator().notice: Numerator for cobb douglas alpha factor.

computeRewardBalanceOfDelegator(bytes32,.notice: Computes the reward balance in GRG of a specific member of a pool.

computeRewardBalanceOfOperator(bytes32).notice: Computes the reward balance in GRG of the operator of a pool.

constructor.notice: Setting owner to null address prevents admin direct calls to implementation.

createStakingPool(address).notice: Create a new staking pool. The sender will be the staking pal of this pool.

creditPopReward(address,uint256).notice: Credits the value of a pool's pop reward.

decreaseStakingPoolOperatorShare(bytes32.notice: Decreases the operator share for the given pool (i.e. increases pool rewards for members).

endEpoch().notice: Begins a new epoch, preparing the prior one for finalization.

finalizePool(bytes32).notice: Instantly finalizes a single pool that earned rewards in the previous epoch,

getCurrentEpochEarliestEndTimeInSeconds(.notice: Returns the earliest end time in seconds of this epoch.

getGlobalStakeByStatus(uint8).notice: Gets global stake for a given status.

getGrgContract().notice: An overridable way to access the deployed GRG contract.

getGrgVault().notice: An overridable way to access the deployed grgVault.

getOwnerStakeByStatus(address,uint8).notice: Gets an owner's stake balances by status.

getPoolRegistry().notice: An overridable way to access the deployed rigoblock pool registry.

getStakeDelegatedToPoolByOwner(address,b.notice: Returns stake delegated to pool by staker.

getStakingPoolStatsThisEpoch(bytes32).notice: Get stats on a staking pool in this epoch.

getTotalStake(address).notice: Returns the total stake for a given staker.

getTotalStakeDelegatedToPool(bytes32).notice: Returns the total stake delegated to a specific staking pool, across all members.

grgReservedForPoolRewards().notice: The GRG balance of this contract that is reserved for pool reward payouts.

init().notice: Initialize storage owned by this contract.

minimumPoolStake().notice: Minimum amount of stake required in a pool to collect rewards.

poolIdByRbPoolAccount(address).notice: Mapping from RigoBlock pool subaccount to pool Id of rigoblock pool

poolStatsByEpoch(bytes32,uint256).notice: Stats for each pool that generated fees with sufficient stake to earn rewards.

rewardsByPoolId(bytes32).notice: mapping from pool ID to reward balance of members

setParams(uint256,uint32,uint256,uint32,.notice: Set all configurable parameters at once.

setStakingPalAddress(bytes32,address).notice: Allows the operator to update the staking pal address.

stake(uint256).notice: Stake GRG tokens. Tokens are deposited into the GRG Vault.

unstake(uint256).notice: Unstake. Tokens are withdrawn from the GRG Vault and returned to the staker.

validPops(address).notice: Registered RigoBlock Proof_of_Performance contracts, capable of paying protocol fees.

withdrawDelegatorRewards(bytes32).notice: Withdraws the caller's GRG rewards that have accumulated until the last epoch.
